dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so we're looking at battery metals, right? But isn't this just, like, a re-run of 2017 all over again? Remember that spectacular bust?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so we're looking at battery metals, right? But isn't this just, like, a re-run of twenty seventeen all over again? Remember that spectacular bust?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For investors. whats happening with battery-metal miners looks like a re-run of the boom conditions in 2017 when share prices rocketed up despite sluggish EV sales. That first flush of demand for mining and exploration companies exposed to lithium, graphite, cobalt and nickel ended in a spectacular bust because metal supply significantly outstripped demand for EVs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Whoa, no, wait, I mean, no! This time it’s totally different.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whoa, no, wait, I mean, no! This time it's totally different.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This time it should be different because EV demand really is rising as seen in last years 36% increase in Tesla sales despite the depressing effects of the Covid-19 pandemic on global mobility and overall vehicle demand.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But, uh, the article literally says it looks like a re-run. That first flush, it just ended in a spectacular bust!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But, uh, the article literally says it looks like a re-run. That first flush, it just ended in a spectacular bust!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For investors. whats happening with battery-metal miners looks like a re-run of the boom conditions in 2017... That first flush of demand for mining and exploration companies exposed to lithium, graphite, cobalt and nickel ended in a spectacular bust...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but that was because EV sales were sluggish, like, no real demand yet. This time? It’s real.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but that was because E V sales were sluggish, like, no real demand yet. This time? It's real.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That first flush of demand for mining and exploration companies exposed to lithium, graphite, cobalt and nickel ended in a spectacular bust because metal supply significantly outstripped demand for EVs. ... This time it should be different because EV demand really is rising...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! Like, Tesla sales up 36% even with COVID, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! Like, Tesla sales up thirty six percent even with COVID, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This time it should be different because EV demand really is rising as seen in last years 36% increase in Tesla sales despite the depressing effects of the Covid-19 pandemic on global mobility and overall vehicle demand.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And Ford had its best EV year ever! And all the traditional guys, Mercedes, Toyota, they’re all in.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Ford had its best E V year ever! And all the traditional guys, Mercedes, Toyota, they're all in.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While Tesla is the current EV leader, it is being joined in the race to overtake internal combustion engines by traditional vehicle leaders, such as Mercedes Benz, Toyota, Ford and Audi.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Um, and those government incentives, that $10,000 tax credit? And Biden, the shift has totally accelerated.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Um, and those government incentives, that ten thousand dollars tax credit? And Biden, the shift has totally accelerated.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Increasing competition for EV sales, as obstacles such as limited charging stations and range anxiety are overcome, is being boosted by government incentives for drivers to make the switch. ... In the two months since the U.S. elected a more environmentally focused President in Joe Biden, the shift towards EVs has accelerated...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, definitely. But the real story, it’s not just the EVs, it's the miners.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, definitely. But the real story, it's not just the EVs, it's the miners.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! Like, Pilbara Minerals, up 137% in eight weeks!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! Like, Pilbara Minerals, up one hundred thirty seven percent in eight weeks!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Pilbara Minerals, an Australian producer of lithium, is up 137% since early November. ... the double-your-money win in just eight weeks is very real for Pilbara shareholders.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I know, right?! And Albemarle, 58% up since November.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, right?! And Albemarle, fifty eight percent up since November.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: U.S.-based Albemarle Corporation has enjoyed a 58% share price rise since November 4, up from $93.43 on the New York Stock Exchange to $147.52 at the close on Friday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Like, these aren't just little bumps, these are massive moves.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Like, these aren't just little bumps, these are massive moves.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And Goldman Sachs, they've lifted their forecasts. They're predicting lithium prices spiking way up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Goldman Sachs, they've lifted their forecasts. They're predicting lithium prices spiking way up.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Goldman Sachs, late last month, lifted its forecasts for lithium. Spodumene (a primary ore of the metal) is tipped to rise from $395 a ton to $536/t this year. Lithium hydroxide (a processed form of the metal) is forecast to rise from $10,882/t to $11,800 and then up to $13,000/t in 2023.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, this isn't just hype this time? This is actual demand outstripping supply?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, this isn't just hype this time? This is actual demand outstripping supply?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The key to the revitalization of the battery metals sector lies in rapid growth in consumer demand for EVs, the missing link in the original flush of enthusiasm, and while it is Tesla leading the way, other vehicle makers are compounding demand growth and potentially exposing a shortage of some critical metals.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, yeah. The missing link from before? It’s here now. We could see real shortages.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, yeah. The missing link from before? It's here now. We could see real shortages.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The key to the revitalization of the battery metals sector lies in rapid growth in consumer demand for EVs, the missing link in the original flush of enthusiasm... If shortages do develop, battery metal prices could spike higher with a corresponding effect on share prices.
